dialogue.text: I tap on Haruka’s name in my phone and wait for her to answer.
I’ve been to her place several times now, so I figure it’s about time to show her the same sort of hospitality she’s shown me.
That and I feel kind of bad since she’s always talking about how lonely she is and whatnot.
But hey, we’ve been gradually getting closer with one another lately.
And she’s one of the few people I know that I don’t feel strange about being seen in public with.
Sure, Ami will likely react the same way she reacted when Sara came over for the first time, but it’s not like I’m going to just avoid everyone because of that.
Besides, Ami and Sara {i}did{/i} get along by the end of that visit.
I’m sure something similar will happen with Haruka.
Hey! What’s up?
Hey, Haruka. Do you have any plans tonight?
Does eating an entire pint of ice cream count as a plan?
Not really, no.
Then I’m totally free. Why?
Do you want to hang out?
I do. How would you feel about coming over to my place for a change?
Your place? Isn’t that on like, the opposite side of town?
Don’t you have a car?
Yeah but...gas.
That sounds like a very minor struggle compared to me taking the bus to your place all the time.
Then you should get a car, too!
But...gas.
Hahaha~ Okay, okay. I’ll come over.
Can you text me the address?
Sure thing. See you soon.
Yup! See you!
I hang up and immediately type out my address to Haruka, who responds with a quick thumbs-up.
From this point on, the night becomes a mission with the objective of only partially ruining Ami’s life rather than full on destroying it.
You see...in her eyes, each new woman that shows up is another obstacle separating the two of us.
And, in addition to being much closer to my age, Haruka possesses one other thing that is sure to set Ami off almost immediately.
Your boobs really {i}are{/i} huge, Haruka.
Dude. What kind of greeting is that?
You haven’t even said hi yet.
Sorry. I wanted to, but it’s been getting a lot harder keeping my thoughts to myself lately.
That sounds like something that could get you into serious trouble someday.
Like, what if I got super offended by that and stormed out of here?
Would you have preferred if I called them small?
I would have preferred if they were never the conversation topic to start off with.
Oh, okay. I think I’m starting to see the issue.
I sure hope so. I kind of directly pointed it out for you.
It’s one thing to stare, which you’ve...very obviously been doing this entire time, but coming out and talking about them isn’t exactly polite.
Like, you don’t see me walking in and being like “Wow...Your shoulders are so broad and you’ve got the figure of an ancient roman warrior.”
Please say things like that when you walk in. They will make me feel better about myself. Between you and me, I am very insecure.
Yeah I’m just gonna stop talking before I say something else that makes me sound like a creep.
Looks like I’m not the only one having trouble keeping my thoughts to myself.
I spend so much of my time inside the cafe that I’m beginning to struggle in the outside world.
I think it might be time for an intervention or something.
Please save me from myself, Sensei.
Uhh, sure.
Where do you want to start?
What do you mean?
Do you not have a plan or anything for tonight?
I've gone to your house a bunch of times and {i}you've{/i} never had a plan. We always just sit there and watch TV.
Duh. That’s my default setting.
If nobody drags me out of the house, I’ll just do that every day for the rest of my life.
I kind of need somebody to lead the way or I’ll turn into a giant, pink blob who can recite all nine seasons of The Office by heart.
That show isn’t even funny.
The only people who say that are contrarians or those who think they’re somehow too good for it because it doesn’t appeal to their {i}superior intellect{/i}.
This sounds like a topic you feel very strongly about.
I’m tired of people pretending The Office isn’t funny. They should all die.
Okay, well anyway...I guess we can just watch TV since that seems to be the entirety of your comfort zone.
But there is something I should warn you about beforehand.
You don’t have one of those doors that I’m not supposed to open under any circumstance, do you?
What? No.
Why would you assume that?
If there’s anything I’ve learned from all that time I’ve spent in my “comfort zone,” it’s that the people you {i}don’t{/i} expect to have secret doors are always the ones that actually have them.
But...I guess you seem kind of like you’d have one. So that means there shouldn’t be one here after all.
Did you make the insult extremely elaborate on purpose or was that just accidental?
A mixture of both, I guess?
So, what’s the thing you need to warn me about?
You’re not just renting this place out from some creepy old guy who’s going to walk out of his room in nothing but his boxers, are you?
Again with the strange assumptions...
The warning is that I’m not sure where my [niece] is today and she could come home at any moment.
Then why didn’t we just chill at my place?
I’m going to feel really awkward if she just comes in and sees us hanging out when I’ve never even met her before.
Who are you and why are your boobs so big?!
See? This is totally weird for me now.
Ami, this is Haruka. She’s a friend of mine.
That still doesn’t answer the second question!
If she continues, I am going to melt her.
Please don't.
I have special melting powers.
Haruka no.
People like you make me sick...
I don’t think she likes me very much.
She’s like an animal. She’ll warm up to you the more she sees you.
I’ve seen her plenty of times. That’s the cafe lady.
Okay, people seriously need to find other things to say about me. This is getting obnoxious.
At least none of them are hiding their true feelings.
I kind of wish they would.
What ever happened to Sara?! She was much nicer to me and her boobs were way smaller!
Did you cast her aside for a discount on coffee?! We have coffee at home!
Sara’s been here already?
Yeah, I invited her over a while back.
I see...
Ami, if you want to see Sara, you can just go visit her at the bar.
No one likes me! I have no one to go with!
Molly likes you, I think.
Molly has work so I {i}can't{/i} go with her!
She’s off today, so you probably could.
Nevermind! Maybe I {i}will{/i} go with Molly!
Ami kicks her boots off at the door and tosses her scarf onto the couch, immediately taking a place beside Haruka right after.
How long is she staying for?
As long as I want. Right, Sensei?
I’m not asking {i}you{/i}, cafe lady. I’m asking my [uncle].
As long as she wants.
And that car parked outside of the house, is {i}that{/i} hers too?
Yup! That’s mine.
I’m asking-
Yes. That is Haruka’s car.
Hah. Owning a car in an urban area like Kumon-mi? Sounds a lot like overcompensation to me.
Nah. I just had some extra money to spare and needed a way to commute back and forth between {i}my own apartment{/i} and my {i}independently owned business{/i}.
Joke’s on you. I’m perfectly content living with my [uncle] and working part time at a place with super cute outfits instead of ugly green visors.
Hey! That shade of green was the result of an informed decision based on years of experience in marketing and service!
Green and brown are earthy colors that create a relaxing atmosphere!
Also, your sweater is like the same exact shade of green as the one in the cafe!
Nuh-uh! How can you even {i}get{/i} a business license if you can’t tell the difference between your ugly shade of green and OLIVE?!
Wow. You two are getting along even better than I thought you’d be.
What do you see in this woman, Sensei?
I-
If you say my boobs, I’m going to kill you.
...I wasn’t going to say that.
I was going to talk about how down to earth and chill you are.
Ami, you don’t have to like Haruka, but what will being mean to her do at this point?
The two of us are already friends, so it’s not like you’re going to get in the middle of that.
But if I’m mean to her and make her feel really weird, she won’t want to come back and hang out with you again.
She’s got a point. This isn’t very fun.
Yeah, but then that would just mean I’d be going to her place instead. Doesn’t that sound even worse?
You wouldn’t...
I already have.
You have?!
Of course. It’s not like I just saw her at the cafe one day and said, “Hey, wanna head back to my place?”
Isn’t that exactly how adults meet each other nowadays?!
I mean, that’s {i}kind of{/i} what happened.
I gave him my number under the pretense of checking on Rin when she was feeling down, but I really just wanted him to call me so we could get to know each other.
Looks like my plan worked out really well, huh?
I’m already meeting the family and everything.
Is there a dog I can pet anywhere? A cat?
Should I just pet this thing instead? She seems kind of feisty.
She doesn’t bite, does she? Cause if she does, I’ll sue.
That head is reserved for my [uncle]! I didn’t give you permission to touch me!
I’m bigger and stronger than you. Try and stop me~
Sensei! Stop her! I am melting!
Feel my wrath, accountant.
Haruka, that’s terrifying.
What? She started it.
I’m just trying to enjoy my time as an intruder here since we were so {i}rudely{/i} interrupted.
I literally live here! Nothing I do is an interruption!
Haruka and I spend the next couple hours talking in the living room while Ami sits on the couch across from us, staring at her the entire time.
Despite the death glare, however, Haruka remains completely unfazed- which I’m sure makes Ami even angrier.
I guess there was no way this visit could have ended as successfully as the one with Sara, but it definitely...could have been worse, I guess?...
No one died. And that’s really all I can ask for when it comes to things like this.
{i}Haruka’s affection has increased to [haruka_love]!{/i}
